#summary How to build SW application in Android with rdfonthego

= Introduction =

 This example shows you how to build a simple Android app with RDFOnthego.

 The source code is <a href='http://rdfonthego.googlecode.com/files/Example.rar'>here.<a>


= Details =
 In this example, we used RDF store to store the foaf profile. Foaf profiles are converted to n-triples by sindice any23 api. To avoid type the URL,we are using QRCode scanner api. The QRCode generator plug-in for FireFog is easily found by google.com, and QRCode scanner for android at android market.

 * Adding triples to store:

 graph	=	new BDBGraph("example");

 graph.load("http://api.sindice.com/any23/any23/?format=ntriples&uri="+contactFoaFid, contactFoaFid);

 graph.sync();

 * Query name of the foafid 

 graph		=	new BDBGraph("example");
 
 Model model	=	new ModelCom(graph);
			
 String queryString = StrUtils.strjoin("\n", 
  "PREFIX foaf:    <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/>" ,
  "SELECT DISTINCT ?name {" ,
  "  ?x foaf:name ?name.",
  "}") ;
		        
 Query query = 	QueryFactory.create(queryString) ;
 nameListString	=	new ArrayList<String>() ;
		  	        
 QueryExecution qExec = QueryExecutionFactory.create(query, model) ;
		    
 for(ResultSet itr=qExec.execSelect();itr.hasNext();){
     QuerySolution sol=itr.next();
     nameListString.add(sol.get("name").toString());
 }

 qExec.close();    

 adapter = new ArrayAdapter<String> FoafCollector.this,R.layout.listview,nameListString);
